column1: very full and floated into the pads, picked off to deep midwicket for a single. Faulkner's front foot has strayed
good length and a hint of swing into the hips, Baz tees off. Not off the middle, but drags it away to the backward square leg boundary
shorter slower, cutter, sticks in the surface and coaxes the batsman into a defensive prod to the off side beside the pitch
pitched up and angling across off stump, Baz stretches out and drives a single down to long-off, who's at the edge of the boundary
full, mid-of is up in the circle for Pierson, stroked straight to Maxwell inside the circle
shorter and slanting away outside off, chopped out to cover
back of a length on middle, shapes in, defended back to him off the back foot
quick fizzer on leg stump, defended to midwicket
nearly 100ks, attacks the pads again, bunted to mid-on off the back foot

... and Beer brings mid-off into play right away. Beer hits these hard lengths in the Powerplay - back of a length and holds its line outside off. Pierson aims a leg-side flick, but this one stops on him. He ends up spooning a catch to Hastings off a leading edge
fired on off stump, the left-hander hangs back and clips to short midwicket
low full-toss on off, he stays leg-side of the ball and drives down to long-off with a slicing finish
dangled up fuller on middle and leg, Baz finds the gap at midwicket and secures a single
Boland gifts Baz an early Christmas present, and the batsman laps it up. Short and wide outside off, he reaches out for the ball with his fast hands and scythes it over cover-point
Baz races down the track and throws Boland off. The bowler goes short and wide outside off. He carves it to the left of Maxwell at long-off
short, wide, four. Need I say more? This was the slower one, but Baz picked it and flayed it away to the cover boundary. Hat-trick of boundaries
Baz makes it four boundaries in a row! Pitched up on middle, Baz does not connect well enough but still clears mid-on running back
veering into the hips, glanced away just wide of short fine leg for one
re-set the radar, Boland. Back of a length but drifting down leg, past the reach of Heazlett
Heazlett, too, has a crack at Boland and goes over extra cover for a boundary of his own. He dashes down the track, Boland goes short and wide again, and cops punishment
sliding across off from over the wicket, really full, Baz squeezes it down past the left of the bowler
good length and angling across off, driven with a slicing finish down to long-off
short and arrowed through on off, 92ks, short-armed to wide long-on
hip-high short ball on middle, rocks back and swats a pull to deep square leg
low full-toss outside off, Baz stretches out, and eases it to the left of Maxwell at long-off
tossed on off, forward and driven down to long-off
back of a length and zips through past the outside edge near the higher part of the bat
Hastings goes wide of the crease and angles in a short ball outside off, Baz sizes it up and launches it into the stands beyond wide long-on
slower, short ball outside off, slugs a pull to deep midwicket
just short of a good length and angling across off, guided to point
goes for a big hook and top-edges it over midwicket
keeps it short and just outside off, miscues a pull, does not carry to deep midwicket
off-stump yorker, nearly 100ks, dug out
Beer continues to keep Baz quiet by attacking the stumps with hard lengths. Back of a length on middle, tips it past the right of the bowler
tossed on the leg stump, backs away outside leg and scoops it up and over extra cover
really full on middle, stays leg-side of the ball and drills it down the ground
tossed outside off, forward and driven through the covers

Hastings back-tracks from mid-on and settles underneath this skier. This was another faster one, 100ks, on a length on off. Heazlett, having backed away outside leg, slogs at it and looks to clear mid-on. No dice
hip-high short ball on off, pulled strongly off the back foot to deep midwicket
another shorter one on off, turned to short midwicket, front-foot no-ball
dragged short and outside off, clubs a pull to deep midwicket

Stoinis fools Baz with an offcutter! Baz feigns to make swinging room, Stoinis digs it short on off stump. The batsman is cramps for room and he is neither pulling nor fending. He does a bit of this, a bit of that, and skies to midwicket
back of a length on middle, stands tall and punches to mid-on
keeps it on a back of a length on middle, forced down to mid-on again
shorter and outside off, sticks in the surface, this offcutter is dragged to deep midwicket
forward and cover-driven with the break in the gap on the off side
turn and bounce outside off, he rides it and guides through point
faster legbreak, starts outside off and skirts past the outside edge
full, pitches on middle and leg, and turns away, inches forward and presses into the covers
shorter legbreak outside off, rides the bounce and square-cuts it out to deep point
too full for the sweep, and sweeping from the stumps is very risky. Try telling that to Ross. He drags it from middle stump to square leg
back of a length and skidding past the big slash outside off
back of a length and bounces over middle as Burns swings for the hills.... and misses
short on middle, cramps the batsman for room, he flaps it through square leg for one
zippy short ball on middle, skids through off the deck and cramps 'em up for room again. Fended off
short and wide outside off, flashed to deep cover for a couple of runs
length ball on off, Burns finally connects with the middle of the bat. He opens up his hips and plants Stoinis beyond the wide long-on fence
short legbreak, chopped from off stump to mid-off off the back foot
another shorter legbreak, this finishes wide of off, carved away to sweeper cover
full-toss on middle, swatted away straight of wide long-on. Was it over the waist? Doesn't seem so to me. Tight call, as the square-leg umpire deems it a wide
The free-hit is dispatched down the ground. Shorter legbreak outside off, loads up and flat-bats it over the bowler's head
dragged short on middle, shovelled away to long-on
tossed up slower and dips outside off, squirts a drive to cover
shorter legbreak spins away outside off, slapped off the back foot to deep point
dug in short and outside off, Burns lines it up and swishes a pull to the midwicket boundary. Not off the middle but the desired result nonetheless
wide of the crease, short and wide outside off, skewed over the top of Pietersen at mid-off
floated full and wide outside off, past the tramline
good length on off, right in the hitting radar, Burns plants his front foot and launches it straight over Hastings' head. He picked the slower ball and lofted it
rising, short ball outside off, 117ks. The batsman jumps off the ground and chops a bottom edge past the right of Dunk behind the wicket
yorker outside off, squeezed out to cover
wide yorker, good ball, but Burns manipulates the field superbly - he opens the face and squirts it between short third man and backward point. 23 runs off the over
makes room outside leg and chops from the stumps to deep point
dragged down outside off, cracked off the back foot to deep point again
full-toss on off, swiped across to the left of wide long-on
shorter legbreak outside off, chopped off the back foot, keeping deep point busy
short and skids through outside off, another chop to deep point
faster and sliding through outside off, chopped behind to short third man
short, wide, this offcutter is carved to backward point
bounces over the top edge. Back of a length and rears up past the attempted cut
short, wide is the plan from Gulbis. He reaches out for the ball with his hands and flashes past the left of cover
slower offcutter outside off, nice change-up, flat-batted back to the bowler
good length = bad length in T20s. Ross clears his front leg and smites it with the bottom hand over cow corner. Bam
dragged down outside off, swatted across the line to wide long-on
length ball skidding across off, tapped soft enough into the vacant spaces at midwicket for a couple
straightens his line, pumped straight past Maxwell for one
dragged down on middle, stabbed down to long-on off the back foot
shovelled from outside off to wide long-on. A fumble in the deep allows the second
full and angling away, driven straight down the ground to long-off
attacks the pads, tucked around the corner for one
slightly back of a length and outside off, Burns raises a 27-ball fifty with a muscular slog over wide long-on

Stoinis fools Burns, too, with the slower offcutter. 110ks, short and sticks in the surface. Burns eyes up a big pull but only shoots a top edge into the night sky. Dunk follows the ball and does well to snaffle this skier
wide of the crease, angling in just outside off, Cutting has a big whoosh and misses
slower short ball outside off, flapped out to deep square leg
back of a length and skids in to rap the top of the pad and run down to third man
hip-high short ball outside off, hammers a pull between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Good tag-team work in the deep from Maxwell and Faulkner
attacks the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
backs away outside leg, Beer held this one back, 81ks, forced to the covers off the back foot
dragged short and spins away outside off, crashed to the off-side sweeper off the back foot
fast fizzer wide outside off, left alone. Beer hits 100ks
wide yorker, beats the batsman, top bowling from Beer
full and angling into the pads, 103ks, squirted to square leg
sprays it short and wide outside off, flat-bats a cut to the left of sweeper cover for three runs
full and wide outside off, cue-ended down to long-on
short and wide outside off, reaches out for the ball with his hands and flat-bats this slower ball down to long-off
really full and wide outside off, Cutting reaches out for the ball with his fast hands and sends the ball sailing over cover. What a terrific strike
wide again, this is the yorker, well past the reach of the batsman now

low full-toss outside off, Cutting goes low, falls over, but still manages to shovel-drive it down the ground past the left of the bowler and right of long-off. Outlandish. Boland stuck his hand out after the ball flew past him
really full and angling into the pads, deflected fine to the keeper
Flies off the helmet to short third man. Banged in short, angling into the head, zips past the hook and sails to the man at 45. Hit him flush on the helmet but Cutting seems okay
full-toss outside off, Cutting lines it up and swings merrily into the second tier beyond midwicket. Over the waist? The umpire says yes and calls no-ball for height
back of a length and outside off, Cuttling lines up the free-hit as well. Mowed away straight of long-on
full and outside off, shovelled across to deep midwicket
slower, fuller, floats away outside off, 105ks, chopped to short third man
finally gets the yorker right, in the blockhole on off, jabbed away off the inside half to midwicket
wide yorker, squeezed out to sweeper cover
filthy full-toss outside off, Ross loads up and biffs it over long-on to bring up a 34-ball fifty. Stars can't hit their lengths at the Gabba
Ross slithers away outside leg, gets a short ball, and short-arms it away to deep square leg
dug short and just outside off, slower in pace, flat-batted to deep midwicket. He checked his shot and pulled it across to the man in the deep

Ross moves a long way across the leg stump. Boland bangs it short and really wide outside off - wider than a set of stumps outside off. Ross stretches his hands and flat-bats it straight to KP at cover
slower short ball outside off, beats Steketee as he is way too early into the hook
dug short and just outside leg, helped on its way fine of short fine leg. Poor ball and duly put away
Dropped! Boland makes a mess of this skier at backward point. Good length on off, slogs across the line, and top-edges it. It hangs up in the night sky and falls through the hands of Boland

Gulbis dives forward from long-on and completes a fine catch. Pretty full on middle, clears his front leg and swings it flat and hard. Gulbis dives forward but has he wrapped his fingers under the ball? The ball squeezes out of his hands as he throws himself onto the ground but he manages to cling onto the catch
short on middle, flat-bats a pull to deep midwicket. Cutting dares to go for the second. The throw from Maxwell is flat and accurate to the keeper. Cutting is caught well short
101ks cutter, Lalor runs down the track and stabs an inside edge into the vacant spaces at midwicket and runs back for the second
Lalor caps the innings with a sliced four past the right of a diving short third man. He makes swinging room, steps out, and carves it away to the boundary
good length, starts outside off, and breaks back in sharply to nearly shave the inside edge. Just bounces over the middle stump. What a cracker to begin with

Swepson catches it on the rebound and sends back Dunk for a duck. Full and wide outside off, hint of awayswing, he reaches out for a big drive and slices it behind in the air. Swepson at short third man leaps and the ball bursts out. He falls behind, scoops it up, and snatches it on the second attempt. Great recovery from Swepson
back of a length and zipping across off, KP shoulders arms
back of a length, nipping in to strike KP on the elbow. He was done in by the legcutter
chest-high short ball on middle, he is late onto the pull, so flaps it in the air but to the right of Baz at short midwicket
back of a length and angling away outside off, he uses the angle and taps it down to deep third man
full awayswinger outside off, Pietersen has a leaden-footed drive and watches the ball move past the outside edge
Pietersen jumps down the ground and Stekete arrows a back-of-a-length ball down the leg side
short and zings past the hip down the leg side, another wide
back of a length on middle, tapped in front of mid-on
full and wide outside off, flashed away past the right of deep third man
short and zings over the cut, beaten
full and skidding into hit the pad as the batsman falls over the flick but this is heading past the leg stump
short and pretty wide outside off, Wright throws his bat at the ball but does not touch it
dug short and outside off, skids on outside off, KP aims for the pull but flaps it in the air over extra cover
ripping bouncer just outside off, 145ks, flies past the head of KP, who does well enough to rock his head out of the way
back of a length and outside off, KP opens up his hips and swings it violently over wide long-on. He simply crunnnnnched it into the boundary

Doggett nabs KP on T20 debut. This was speared full and wide outside off, KP stays leg-side of the ball and flat-bats it hard. The ball dies on mid-off, but Baz judges it well to bend low and snap it up smartly. KP walks off to a round of boos from the Gabba crowd
back of a length and outside off, 143ks, Maxwell stands up tall and crisply punches wide of mid-off
short and wide outside off, cut off the back foot in the gap at backward point
short of a good length and outside off, drags a pull over the top of mid-on
full and swinging in on middle, Wright clears his front leg and hacks off the inside half to deep midwicket
very full on middle and leg, 139ks, driven past the right of mid-on
full and skidding through the corridor past the swinging bat
Wright makes swinging room by jumping outside leg and cracks it through cover-point off the middle of the bat
chest-high short ball on the leg stump, top-edged hook over the keeper's head for four
Maxwell greets him to the BBL with a pulled six. Fractionally short and outside off, sits up, Maxwell rocks back and smashes it over midwicket
shorter and outside off, chopped to cover-point

Shadab hits back to have Maxwell hole out to long-on. This was a short legbreak, half-tracker outside off, but he had the protection in the deep. Maxwell did not get all of it and found Doggett. The two BBL debutants Shadab and Doggett combine for the wicket. Maxwell's troubles v legspin continue
slider, fuller and fizzes in on off, defended cautiously to the leg side
tossed up on off stump, mid-off is inside the circle, Stoinis stretches out and drives it effortlessly over the top of that fielder
dragged down on middle, cramps the batsman for room, pulled to deep midwicket
dragged short and wide outside off, Stoinis jumps off the ground and clubs it over backward point. Stoinis hits the ball as hard as anyone
overpitched on middle, 141ks, belted right back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, 137ks, the batsman stays leg-side of the ball and biffs it to extra cover
Stoinis stands outside leg, fetches this full ball from outside off and biffs it to cover again. Baz spears a direct hit at the keeper's end but Stoinis is in. Baz reminding everyone he still has it
veering into the pads, glanced square of short fine leg
clipped off the hips to short fine leg
flatter legbreak outside off, 90ks, chopped off the back foot to backward point
112ks fizzer, skids on off, hastily chopped to backward point again
perfectly-pitched legbreak outside off, played with soft hands past slip
lobbed up on leg and turns away, dips sharply too, chipped in the air to long-off
Shadab has two in two overs on BBL debut! Looks like a googly, breaks back in, breaches through the weak defences of Wright and makes a mess of the stumps. The force is with legspin
full and dips on of, forward and pushed down to long-on
back of a length, wrong'un, breaks in, punched on the up to cover. Faulkner picked it
follows the wrong'un with a sharp legbreak, which squares up Faulkner and skirts past the outside edge
slower short ball on middle, flaps a pull in the air but does not carry to deep midwicket
back of a length and on the hips, whipped with the wrists to deep midwicket
dipping full-toss on middle, bunted down to long-on
forward and chipped over short cover to the left of long-off
lobbed up outside off, flat-batted down to long-off
liberally tossed up on middle, Stoinis is right to the pitch of the ball as he lofts it beautifully over the bowler's head. Such a clean swing
drags this legbreak outside off, swatted down to long-off with a flat bat
short and turns away outside off, chopped hard but straight to sweeper cover
flipper on middle and leg, tucked into the vacant spaces at midwicket
tossed up and outside off, stretches out and hits with the break over long-off. Stoinis is such a clean striker
fired onto the pads, 90ks, misses the sweep as the ball rolls to short fine leg
tossed up, turns, and dips, sliced wide of backward point
sliding down leg, wide
dragged down on off, pulled to wide long-on
short dart just outside off, nearly 100ks, stabbed back to the bowler
tossed-up legbreak outside off, chipped over extra cover
slower cutter on off, run back down the pitch to the bowler
Faulkner comes down the track, meets a 140ks short ball, quietly bunts to cover for a quick single
hip-high short ball on middle, Stoinis swivels on the back foot and cracks a pull between deep square leg and deep midwicket. Excellent timing and placement to boot
short on middle and leg, dragged straight to deep midwicket this time
slower offcutter, defended back to him
full and wide outside off, shovelled across the line to wide long-on
leg-side wide
low full-toss on middle, whipped to deep midwicket
shorter legbreak outside off, cut along the ground to sweeper cover
slower through the air on middle, 74ks, tip and run to the leg side
dangles this legbreak outside off, dabbed square on the off side with soft hands
picked off the pads to short fine leg
really full and outside off, the batsman can't get under the length. Forced down to long-off
back of a length on middle, clears his front leg and violently clubs it past the right of the bowler
full and wide outside off, flat-bats it in the air but past the left of a tumbling Baz at mid-off. Stoinis soars to fifty off 26 balls
slower offcutter outside off, pumped over extra cover
length ball on off, 114ks slower one, Stoinis picks the change-up and plants Cutting over wide long-on
slower bouncer outside off, Stoinis can't ramp it away. Beaten by the 112ks offcutter
just short of a good length and outside off, swings it baseball-style into the long-on boundary. Stoinis keeps giving Stars hope
What was that? A full-toss that sails over the head of a still Faulkner. The flipper goes awry. No-ball, of course
Swepson attempts another flipper but this comes out as a full-toss on middle, Faulkner presses forward and smites it over midwicket
Swepson manages to pitch this attempted flipper, on middle, whipped down to long-on
dangles up a legbreak, starts on off and breaks past the outside edge
wrong'un, nudged with the spin to square leg
pitches on leg and spins away, stabbed with the break to cover
fired outside off, slid off the face to backward point
Faulkner slithers outside leg, the bowler follows him and hits a hard length. Pushed up to cover
back of a length and zings through outside off, he has a big whoosh... and misses
shuffles across off, picks it up with the wrists and hits it over square leg
floats a slower ball past the tramline, off-side wide
this is even wider outside off
back of a length and outside off, toe-ended back over the bowler's head
length ball outside off, Faulkner has a big yahooo at it and sends it soaring over midwicket with a slog sweep
short and wide outside off, flat-batted to the left of long-on. Excellent work in the deep from Labuschange
pushed through and holds its line outside off, 111ks, Stoinis uses the pace of the bowler and reverses it fine on the off side
shorter legbreak outside off, back-foot force to sweeper cover
shorter and wider outside off, slapped out to sweeper cover
dangles a slower legbreak that breaks past the bat in the corridor
Stoinis dances out, yorks himself, and stabs it back
shorter on off, whipped in front of long-on for a double
short and wide outside off, angling away from over the wicket, scythed to deep cover. Faulkner scampers across for the second
slower bouncer outside off, beats Faulkner's attempt to upper-cut it away
full and wide outside off, 110ks, Faulkner manufactures his own pace and flat-bats it down the ground past the right of the bowler
wide of the crease, very full and angling in at off, whipped with the wrists to long-on for just one
short and wide outside off, hangs back and drags the ball to deep midwicket

wide of the crease, pretty full and holds its line outside off, carted through the line to extra cover. They scamper across for a single. A direct hit at the bowler's end could have had Faulkner. They pinch an extra run via an overthrow
full on the leg stump, following the batsman, who was backing away. Pumped down the ground. Baz chases hard, and flicks the ball into the field of play before sliding over the boundary
short and wide outside off, backs away and slashes to backward point. There's a mix-up between the wickets, eventually a dot
full and wide outside off, swished down to long-off running in
short and rises on middle, steps away outside leg and carves to cover-point
back of a length and outside off, flat-bat swat down to long-on
back of a length on off, flicked away to deep midwicket for two more. Good work from Doggett too. Just 25 off the last three overs
short of a good length and slanting away outside off, the batsman hangs back and swats it in the air. Two men converge at long-on but Stoinis clears the boundary
Stoinis clears long-off now. He gets under this full ball and lifts it over Baz, I think
slower short ball on middle, he swings early, and cue-ends it down to long-on
dug in short and outside off, right up there for Faulkner to pull it away to his favourite midwicket boundary
wide yorker outside off, toe-ended past the left of the bowler
really full on off, not a perfect yorker, but the batsman can't get under the length. Whipped up to long-on
full on off, clubbed across the line between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Good tag-team work in the deep
Baz back-tracks from mid-off, stretches his hands, but this miscue clears him. Faulkner gave himself room and sliced it away
Pierson, the keeper, runs back and misses this skier. It hung up in the sky for a long time. Short and cramps the moving batsman for room. The result is a swirling top edge, which Pierson drops

Stoinis has been dropped on 98 but has been run out on 99. Stunning innings from Stoinis but it can't get his side past the line. He slugs this back-of-a-length ball straight to deep midwicket but Labuschange now drops the catch. He recovers a fires a throw at the keeper's end. Stonis is caught short despite a full-length dive
back of a length on off, he clears his front leg and hacks it away to the right of long-on. Good running catch from Doggett
Faulkner shuffles a fair way outside the leg stump and manufactures swinging room, but this is a short, slower cutter outside off, forced to the covers
